titlestmt.titleproper: University of Kentucky School of Music. Society of Composers, Inc., Central Kentucky Student Chapter. Kentucky New Music Festival records
Guide to the University of Kentucky School of Music. Society of Composers, Inc., Central Kentucky Student Chapter. Kentucky New Music Festival records, 1973-2011, undated 2024ua018
titlestmt.author: Becca J. Taylor and Ruth E. Bryan

publicationstmt.publisher: University of Kentucky Special Collections Research Center

profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

repository.corpname: University of Kentucky Special Collections Research Center

did.unittitle: University of Kentucky School of Music. Society of Composers, Inc., Central Kentucky Student Chapter. Kentucky New Music Festival records

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Society of Composers. University of Kentucky Chapter

did.abstract: The University of Kentucky School of Music. Society of Composers, Inc., Central Kentucky Student Chapter. Kentucky New Music Festival records (festival/submission dates 2007-2011, undated; composition creation dates 1973-2011, undated; 5.14 cubic feet, 14 boxes) comprise scores, recordings, biographical information, program notes, and submission letters notes from submissions to the Kentucky New Music Festival held by the University of Kentucky School of Music and the Central Kentucky Student Chapter of the Society of Composers, Inc.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open to researchers by appointment.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Collection is arranged chronologically into 5 series: 2007 Festival, 2008 Festival, 2010 Festival, 2011 Festival, and No Festival Date. Within each series, records are arranged in alphabetical order by composer's last name.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Kentucky New Music Festival was held annually at the University of Kentucky between 2007 and at least 2010 and possibly longer. Adam Sovkoplas, a U.K. composition graduate student, organized the festival under the umbrella of the University of Kentucky School of Music and the Central Kentucky Student Chapter of the Society of Composers, Inc (SCI). The goal of the festival was to promote the creation and performance of new classical music with a focus on composers from Central Kentucky. By its fourth year, in 2010, the festival consisted of six concerts and a lecture. The concerts presented a variety of musical styles and ensembles including music for orchestra, piano trio, chamber ensemble, organ, and electronic presentation.
Sources Nichols, E., and Hale, W. (2010, October 15). New Classical Music the Focus of Upcoming Festival. UKNow. https://uknow.uky.edu/arts-culture/music/new-classical-music-focus-upcoming-festival

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: 2024ua018 : [identification of item], University of Kentucky School of Music. Society of Composers, Inc., Central Kentucky Student Chapter. Kentucky New Music Festival records, 1973-2011, undated, University of Kentucky Libraries Special Collections Research Center.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The University of Kentucky School of Music. Society of Composers, Inc., Central Kentucky Student Chapter. Kentucky New Music Festival records (festival/submission dates 2007-2011, undated; composition creation dates 1973-2011, undated; 5.14 cubic feet, 14 boxes) comprise scores, recordings, biographical information, program notes, and submission letters from submissions to the Kentucky New Music Festival. Many submissions include a score of the piece submitted for consideration, a live or MIDI recording, program notes, and biographical notes about the composer. The submissions came from approximately 34 different states in the United States and from several other countries including Australia, Canada, Italy, and Germany. Compositions vary widely in style and instrumentation. Four festival/submission years are present in the collection: 2007, 2008, 2010, and 2011 along with several undated submissions. The collection does not include submissions from the 2009 festival.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Property rights reside with the University of Kentucky. The University of Kentucky holds the copyright for materials created in the course of business by University of Kentucky employees. Copyright for all other materials has not been assigned to the University of Kentucky. For information about permission to reproduce or publish, please contact the Special Collections Research Center.
Scores are available for study and for performance in educational settings in accordance with the Fair Use clause of U.S. copyright law.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Pieces included: 1 score, 2 CDS . Notes: There are three different recordings of Mirrored Pursuit, two are the only recording on the disk one is on a disk with a recording of The Mountain by the same composer. On disk 1 the tracks are labeled 1. Performance and 2. Demo (for rehersal only). On disk 2 the tracks are labeled 1. performance and 2. Demo (MIDI piano). Disk 3 contains Mirrored Pursit and The Mountain and is housed with The Mountain along with a submission letter, and biographical/program note which discuss both pieces by the same composer. The score and disk 3 were receieved in the same envelope and disks 1 and 2 were received in a separate enevelope.The score and disk 3 were in an envelope with the following notes on envelope: WB1.1 .06, WB1.2 .07. Disks 1 and 2 were in the same envelope as the recordings of five other pieces: Behind the Blue Sky by Nickitas Demos, a CD of A Nonfunctional Teapot by Tim Reed, and a CD of Blowout (expanded), Jam, and Still Transformations. Note on this envelope (possibly not relevant): DN1.1 .WE. .

CD includes two other pieces: Shapeshifter, for flute and piano, and Mystic Rhythm, for flute, alto saxophone and two marimbas..
